text: I have collection of neural networks that i have trained on a cognitive task. The output, `y` is a probability of choosing right/left. I want to run a generalized-linear mixed model on some aspect of the activity of the network on it’s output (`y~X`) (basically doing “neuroscience” on the RNN). However, since `y` is a probability, `MixelModels.jl` doesn’t allow me to specify  `Bernoulli()` as the distribution. Other than “sampling” binary choices from the network, is there another way to fit this? In MATLAB `fitglm` is ok with this kind of data.
